data.title: Autoplay animation starts from last editor state
data.body:
New objects with autoplay animation _**renders their first frame with state i leaved in editor**_. Next frames draws according autoplay animation. I think it is bad behavior.

For example i want my scene to smooth alpha intro. If i leave animation editor somewhere in the middle, new instances will flicker a frame. To fix this i will put time marker right to the start (where alpha is 0). It is uncomfortable to do: i must do this with every autoplay animation. But when i want to edit scene i will make it visible by dragging time marker, and then pop it to start when i'm done.

I think autoplay animation will start and draw the first frame as it in animation 0 frame.

**Link to minimal example project:** shows flickering and fixed version of same animation
[test-anim.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1034456/test-anim.zip) (Godot 3.0 project)

ps: this issue meets at any versions of Godot

data.title: Use new icons everywhere
data.body: Closes #8879

data.title: Added script overview
data.body:
Adds a script overview to the script editor.

The overview currently just contains the functions in the current script. By clicking on the function in the list will it take you to the function.  There is also a setting to enable and disable the script overview. Below is a preview:

![screenshot 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6584330/26529566/fa67a5c6-43b9-11e7-8293-b6fc6a3d6123.jpg)

This is based on @reduz in #6066 and @kirilledelman in #2732.

Closes #3238.

data.title: Fixed rand_range not returning correct random values on windows
data.body:
This pull request fixes https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/8957
The Visual Studio C++ compiler seems not to automatically use unsigned int for the enums.
Declaring unsigned int explicitly for the enum fixes that problem.

data.title: Fixing typo for rect_position in _change_notify call for Control
data.body:
It caused a bug that when I update margins for a Label (or any 2d gui Control Node), the Position  2dVector would not update.

P. S. My first PR

data.title: EditorHelp: Help>Class now switch to script editor
data.body: This fixes a bug when selecting a class from Help>Class dialog while the editor is in 2D, 3D, or Assetlib, it wouldn't switch to script editor automatically. (Unlike Help>Search)

data.title: CreateDialog: fix activating recent item creates node selected in search result
data.body:
Step to reproduce:
1. Open Create New Node dialog, select an item in recent list e.g. Control.
2. Select another node in search result e.g. Button.
3. Activate the same item in recent list (Control), and node from search result (Button) is created instead.

data.title: CreateDialog: select root if search exactly match
data.body:
Fixes  #8947
Also fixes similar issue when creating Resource and get VisualScriptResourcePath instead.

data.title: Fix moving path controls in edit mode.
data.body:
The previous code would never trigger the subsequent conditionals (for
moving the control points) when in EDIT_MODE because the point
conditionals were nested instead of being a conjunction.

data.title: Use builtin BC decompression when libsquish not available
data.body:
I've revived and re-fixed the old builtin decompression code since it's needed for platforms when BC compression is not supported.

libsquish is disabled for non-tool builds because it depends on the C++ standard library, which is not available on those.

Probably the right thing to do is tweaking the build process so libsquish can be used universally, but at least, after this PR games with BC-compressed textures stop crashing on iOS. :)

data.title: Use builtin BC decompression when libsquish not available (2.1)
data.body:
I've revived and re-fixed the old builtin decompression code since it's needed for platforms when BC compression is not supported.

libsquish is disabled for non-tool builds because it depends on the C++ standard library, which is not available on those.

Probably the right thing to do is tweaking the build process so libsquish can be used universally, but at least, after this PR games with BC-compressed textures stop crashing on iOS. :)

__Update:__
Since tweaking the build system is not very worth due to the fact that 3.0 won't require it, we could keep this as it would be after this PR for 2.1.
My only concern is that the builtin decompressor handles BC1-BC3, while libsquish mat output some other formats. Does anybody know if that happens in practice or we are safe supporting those only (as has always been the case)?

data.title: Enable libsquish for non-tools builds (2.1)
data.body: Needed now that it's used for decompressing textures on the fly on platforms that don't support BC.

data.title: Enable libsquish for non-tools builds
data.body: Needed now that it's used for decompressing textures on the fly on platforms that don't support BC.

data.title: Using Freelook and Zoom at the same time changes zoom max and min values
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux Mint 18.1 - Godot 3.0 custom build

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
When you hold down the RMB and Scroll, the extent that you can zoom changes.
This also changes the speed at which you can zoom.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1) Go to a 3d scene with something to look at as a reference point
2) hold down the right mouse button and scroll until you are to the minimum value for zoom the very helpful scroll bar in the scene view should not be filled
3) let go of the right mouse button
4) keep using the scroll wheel

data.title: OpenSSL: Cleanup and document update process from upstream sources + 1.0.2l
data.body:
This PR just documents the update process, tries to remove Godot-made changes in upstream sources (need testing on MSVC!) and gets rid of some unnecessary files.

The changes were based on the same 1.0.2h version as before. The last commit then updates to 1.0.2l.

data.title: Live reload does not work with class member variables

I have this bit of code and I was changing the value of the speed variable using the live reload feature. The script got reloaded but the the speed did not change:
```
var speed = 300;

func _fixed_process(delta):
	...
	var motion = move_direction.normalized() * speed * delta
	move(motion)
```

**Steps to reproduce:**


**Link to minimal example project:**

data.title: rand_range seems not to work on windows in godot 3.0
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Operating system: Windows 10 (Version 1703 / OS Build 15063.296)
Godot version: 3.0 - master b93fce1c18a58e752c07a634ed11aa8ec199601d

**Issue description:**
rand_range in gdscript doesn't seem to work on windows (tested mac and ubuntu and it did work there)
```
randomize()
var rndtest = rand_range(0.0, 200.0)
print(rndtest)
```
Outputs e.g. -705028414800 while the debugger shows -16777216
randf() didn't work as well while randi() seemed to work fine.
Compiled with vs2015 and vs2017 CE and tried x86 and x64 builds of godot.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a new project and add the above code snippet to a node.

**Link to minimal example project:**
Example project: [testproject-x86.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1033513/testproject-x86.zip)

data.title: Fix incorrect input event reference in editor_profiler.cpp
data.body: This fixes the segfault mentioned in #8954. See that issue for details.

data.title: Fix incorrect input event reference in animation_editor.cpp
data.body: This fixes the segfaults mentioned in #8938.  See that issue for details.

data.title: Godot crashes when profiler graph is clicked
data.body:
The wrong input event variable is referenced on line 526 of editor_profiler.cpp and godot segfaults as a result.  This was broken when @reduz made his recent InputEvent changes.  Based on the old version of the code, it looks like the "mb" variable should be "mm".  Using the correct variable restores the old behavior.  I will be putting out a pr shortly.

Related to issue #8938.

data.title: Improve/harmonize mobile builds
data.body:
Android:
- Inexistent `DEBUG_MEMORY_ALLOC` replaced by `DEBUG_MEMORY_ENABLED`.

iOS:
- Unconditional __-fblocks__. Formerly it was being added only if _GameCenter_ enabled.
- Fix failing build if _GameCenter_ disabled by adding _GameController_ explicitly.
- Make _release_ and _release_debug_ be the same, except for `DEBUG_ENABLED` (for Android we are doing the same), which is: `-O2 -ftree-vectorize -fomit-frame-pointer -ffast-math -funsafe-math-optimizations`.
- Remove some redundant `-isysroot $IPHONESDK`.
- Drop the _profile_ target.
- Enable link-time optimization (slow, but hopefully gives a faster engine).

@punto-, could you have a look?:
- I know you removed `-ffast-math` because of a possible compler bug. Do you think that still applies?
- Do you know about anyone using the _profile_ target?
- And any other possible wrong thing you find.

data.title: Improve/harmonize mobile builds (2.1)
data.body:
Android:
- Inexistent `DEBUG_MEMORY_ALLOC` replaced by `DEBUG_MEMORY_ENABLED`.

iOS:
- Unconditional __-fblocks__. Formerly it was being added only if _GameCenter_ enabled.
- Fix failing build if _GameCenter_ disabled by adding _GameController_ explicitly.
- Make _release_ and _release_debug_ be the same, except for `DEBUG_ENABLED` (for Android we are doing the same), which is: `-O2 -ftree-vectorize -fomit-frame-pointer -ffast-math -funsafe-math-optimizations`.
- Drop the _profile_ target.
- Enable link-time optimization (slow, but hopefully gives a faster engine).

@punto-, could you have a look?:
- I know you removed `-ffast-math` because of a possible compler bug. Do you think that still applies?
- Do you know about anyone using the _profile_ target?
- And any other possible wrong thing you find.

__NOTE:__ The _master_ version is subject to @punto-'s opinion at least, so this shouldn't be merged before the other one is approved.

data.title: [Bug] GraphNode is created instead of Node if selected from Recent list
data.body:
**Windows 64bits - v2.1.3**

**Issue description:**
If you add a Node to a scene and select it via the _Recent_ list, it creates a GraphNode instead. Doesn't seem to happen with any other node.

http://i.imgur.com/e2zphKm.gif

**Steps to reproduce:**
Add a new node to a scene (CTRL+A), select Node from the _Recent_ list.
